intro: Ruellia calycosa, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are square and often branched. Ruellia calycosa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and adaptability to various soil types.
